venue.name: Mass Central Rail Trail Parking Lot

item.description:
Take a ride on the Mass Central Rail Trail (MCRT), a converted section of unused railroad right-of-way. This section parallels the meandering Quinapoxet River and ends in the town of of Holden. Along the way is an old textile mill site and its nearby tenements.

The trail's fairly level with slight rutting. The surface is hard dirt with a bit of small-pebble gravel: mountain bikes are better-suited than road bikes. Mosquitos can be a problem, so bring some protection.

The trail opens with a three-mile-long flat stretch. After that, we can swing to the north and continue onto a hillier portion. We could also optionally swing south, returning to the start along the opposite side of the river.

Directions from Worcester:
1. Take I-190 to EXIT 4 (Rt. 12, West Boylston).
2. At the end of the exit ramp is a T-intersection: turn LEFT onto Route 12 North.
3. Go through four more sets of lights (two miles). NOTE: At the fourth light is a junction with Route 140.
4. Cross the reservoir (landmark: Old Stone Church) and immediately bear LEFT to follow Route 140.
5. At the next intersection (one mile), you'll see the MCRT parking area across the road and slightly to the left.

From points southeast:
1. Take I-290 to EXIT 23B (Rt. 140 North).
2. Follow Route 140 North about five miles to the second traffic light (junction with Route 12).
3. Continue on Route 140 North.
4. After crossing the reservoir (landmark: Old Stone Church), bear LEFT tofollow Route 140 another mile.
5. At the next intersection (one mile), you will see the parking area across the road and slightly to the left.

From Leominster and points north and west:
1. Take I-190 South to EXIT 5 (Rt. 140).
2. At the end of the ramp turn LEFT onto Route 140 South.
3. Go one mile south. NOTE: DO NOT turn left when Route 140 jogs left: just go straight.
4. Immediately after Route 140 jogs left, you will see the parking area on your right.


Rain date: September 19th, same time.
item.how_to_find_us: I'll be in the parking area. Look for the "Meetup" sign.
